generation

Class BSPNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.BSPNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BSPBranch, BSPLeaf

    public class BSPNode
extends java.lang.Object
    BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates. Leaf nodes carry a list of segments. A BSP tree is a data structure to search for a set of segments to put on display in the FirstPersonDrawer. Superclass for BSPBranch and Leaf nodes that carry further data. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

      • store

        public int store(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                 org.w3c.dom.Element mazeXML,
                 int number)
        Store the content of a BSPNode including data of branches and leaves as special cases.
        Parameters:
        root - is the node considered
        doc - document to add data to
        mazeXML - element to add data to
        number - is an index number for this node in the XML format
        Returns:
        the highest used index number, in this case the given number
